description.narrative: Capacity Building project seeks to close the existing technical and institutional capacity challenges related to climate transparency in Ethiopia

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: Solutions scaled up for sustainable management of natural resources, including sustainable commodities and green and inclusive value changes -Presence of a well-functioning inter-ministerial body/organization inclusive of all line ministries -Number of line ministries are fully conversant with the roles and Tasks in implementing the MRV and 50% of taskforce established to clarify roles to be women - Number of skills/trained staff on 2006 IPCC guidelines, GHG Inventory and MRV •Composition of women on training programmers to be 50%

comment.narrative: Two -None -Current no taskforce exist (None)None, •Currently women take approximately 10% of climate change training programmers

• Enhanced capacity of the stakeholders by lobby and advocating for clearly defined roles and tasks in climate change work sphere (Clearly defined roles and tasks of stakeholders for the implementation of the transparency requirements)-Target 8 Key stakeholders • Establishment and operationalization of a national GHG emission inventory system. (National system for GHG emission inventory and functional GHG database and information system established) Target -1 • An existence of 1 set of guidelines document detailing processes and steps applied in the framework of the domestic MRV system to track and reporting NDC implementation measures • Experts in key sectoral ministries regional states and city administration fully conversant on the transparency framework. – Target 180 Individuals will be trained • Data collection widened and improved to sustain the use of 2006 IPCC guidelines- Target -1 dataset will be collected • National universities engaged to support the competent authority in establishing QA/QC procedure and uncertainty analysis of the GHG inventory. Target – 3 National Universities  Organize capacity building training for 100 (70 male and 30 female)- on the newly developed legal frame work for Federal, Regional environmental inspectors, stakeholders and private transformer manufacturers  Enforcement of PCB legal framework within key PCB management sectors, including government administration, PCB holders and involved stakeholders

• An existence of 1 set of guidelines document detailing processes and steps applied in the framework of the domestic MRV system to track and reporting NDC implementation measures • 177 Experts, in key sectoral ministries, regional states and city administrations, fully conversant on the transparency framework and by end 75% of the women workforce within the line • The continuous training strengthened the technical skills of experts to Monitor and Report GHG in transparent manner (Oromia Region) • GHG Inventory Quality Assurance and Quality Control (QA/QC) Plan/procedure developed • Forest area & area change analysis (Forest MRV) of Year 2021 were made and validated • Project annual HACT Audit Conducted & Cleared

-One , and by end of project 50% of functional body membership to comprise of women -Eleven (11) -180
.

 The project has achieved its milestone activities by having the inventory data of all transformers with necessary information in the country. This is the foundation of the major project activities, thus it is great achievement.  Project Steering Committee (PSC) has been established and the PSC has conducted first, second and third meetings.  The project overarching guiding plan “National Management Plan for Polychlorinated Biphenyls (PCBs), 2019-2022” is prepared up on conducting training.  Procurement of sampling and analysis of PCB kits and equipment is finalized. Winner of the bid is identified, offer is given and now it is on the final delivery arrangement. This is also a major milestone activity in having the subsequent tasks to get done.  Ethiopia has proclaimed Proclamation entitled “Industrial Chemical Registration and Administration Proclamation” No. 1075/2018. However, Ethiopia has no national system for registration and administration of chemicals. With the assistance of the project “Establishment of key elements of national systems for sound chemicals management in selected countries in Eastern Europe, Caucasus and Central Asia (Belarus, Georgia and Kazakhstan). The project has established chemical data base software. The software has helped the responsible institutions to customize the software and establishment chemicals registry. It enabled any person who is producing, importing, exporting, distributing, storing, or using industrial chemicals to have online record keeping and reporting which has huge benefit in terms of time, cost and avoiding litigation by the law enforcing body.  To make the software functional, four back to back workshops were conducted:-  Endorsement and launching ceremony was held in the presence of Ministries and Commissioners;  Technical Team Training (3 day training);  Two days Training workshop was given for experts drawn from Companies which produce and/or import chemical  Media briefing and orientations was given to chemical factory managers on the commencement of chemical registration and associated responsibility (1 day event)  Similarly, PCB management database was also developed; the data base will be used for the inventory of transformers, keeps record of transformers with PCB chemical and the status in which the transformer is located.  Theoretical and practical Training of trainers (TOT) was given by UNITAR (via zoom) on PCB chemical screening and analysis  Thereafter three separate training was given to all experts (Technician from EEU, EEP and Ethio-Engineering Group, EFCCC and Regional experts) who will conduct the PCB transformers screening and analysis  Legal frame work on PCB management (in English) prepared  Communication and awareness raising strategy on PCB chemical and other hazardous chemical prepared  An awareness raising on PCB and other chemicals was given to regions and other stakeholders  Awareness creation on PCB and other hazardous chemicals given to women  training was given on Stockholm Convention, facility level PCB Management Plan, Occupational Health, Safety and Emergency Response  Contractual agreement for laboratory service signed, budget dispersed and training was given on Gas Chromatography as way of reinforce the national analytical capacity to support PCB management in Ethiopia.  Tender process is underway to procure laboratory chemicals reagents for PCB analysis to be used by laboratory service i.e Ethiopia Conformity Assessment Enterprise  First training was given on TOT approach and thereafter training was given to all experts who will conduct the screening  PCB suspected transformers were mapped according to Regional distribution  Analysis and identification of transformers having PCB was conducted  478 transformers were examined out of 252 samples were collected.  PCB data complied using the database sheet  Second phase Procurement of materials and Goods (PPE and1000 PCB test kits) in the process  Document on Chemical response procedures and mechanisms prepared  The Directive on PCB translated in to Amharic  But the COVID pandemic has exerted challenges to move forward, to mitigate this; the project team has designed COVID 19 Related Risk of Implementation and Possible Mitigation Measures and implemented it accordingly.  More importantly, the project performance is hampered by the unavailability of the transport vehicles; the project team has tried to mitigate the problem by securing one vehicle from EFCCC and given the number of car, the project team has made good stride in conducting the inventory of PCB transforms.  Training was given on • Stockholm Convention, • Occupational Health, Safety and Emergency Response to all relevant stakeholders.  As a result, document on Chemical response procedures and mechanisms prepared.  Training on the preparation of Facility-level PCB management plans was given. Subsequently, Ethiopian Electric Utility (EEU) PCB Management Plan Prepared  In sum, evaluating the project performance against the objectives and outcomes to be achieved at the end of project targets is satisfactory.

• Enhanced capacity of the stakeholders by lobby and advocating for clearly defined roles and tasks in climate change work sphere (Clearly defined roles and tasks of stakeholders for the implementation of the transparency requirements)-Target 8 Key stakeholders • Establishment and operationalization of a national GHG emission inventory system. (National system for GHG emission inventory and functional GHG database and information system established) Target -1 • Experts in key sectoral ministries regional states and city administration fully conversant on the transparency framework. – Target 180 Individuals will be trained • Data collection widened and improved to sustain the use of 2006 IPCC guidelines- Target -1 dataset will be collected • National universities engaged to support the competent authority in establishing QA/QC procedure and uncertainty analysis of the GHG inventory. Target – 3 National Universities
